definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Hero, in a police bandit pursues in tangled warfare, had their absurd first meeting.
sentences.chinese: 痞子与英雄在一场警匪追逐的混战中，荒谬初会。

sentences.english: He thinks he's bad-ass because he wears a bandana .
sentences.chinese: 他觉得他头上戴了条印花头巾就是个痞子样了。

sentences.english: “Imagine what Eminem is going to say,” he said.
sentences.chinese: “想象痞子阿姆会说些什么，”他说。

sentences.english: A mangy-lookin' guy goes into a bar and orders a drink.
sentences.chinese: 一个看起来像痞子的伙计走进一家酒吧点了一杯酒喝。

sentences.english: Finally ya simulation test, the rascal was arranged in front of me.
sentences.chinese: 最后一次模拟考，痞子被安排在我的前面。

sentences.english: A person once was a ruffian.
You are just a punk , you know that?
sentences.chinese: 你只是个痞子，你知道吗？

sentences.english: Ruffian and Hero, in a police bandit pursues in tangled warfare, had their absurd first meeting.
sentences.chinese: 痞子与英雄在一场警匪追逐的混战中，荒谬初会。

sentences.english: Where did these monkeys get a million Es?
sentences.chinese: 这些痞子怎么弄到一百万颗？

sentences.english: She disrupts the rhythm completely which how Ruffian &Hero handles a case.
sentences.chinese: 完全打乱痞子英雄办案的节奏。

definition: (Wu dialect) bum/wretched-looking tramp who lives by begging or stealing
dog's leg/fig. one who follows a villain/henchman/hired thug
